oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rapid Procedure for the Testing of Nonnutritive Objects Found in Various Confectionary Products, Posing as a Possible Choking Hazard
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Loechlt-Yoshioka, Hans Y.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: choking
chocolate
confectionary products
hazard
screening procedure
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Nonnutritive objects (toys) in confectionary food products can be a choking hazard for children under three years of age. A rapid method for the screening these types of toys is presented in this paper. It was found, that the use of a clear plastic cylinder is ideal for this rapid screening procedure of these products. By using this clear plastic cylinder, there was no need to measure each toy individually.https://doi.org/10.21423/jrs-v04n02p022 (DOI assigned 7/3/2019)
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Office of the Texas State Chemist
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Journal of Regulatory Science; Vol. 4 No. 2 (2016); 22-27
